response.overview: ‘Isolated Canvas’ is a film made and produced during the peak of the COVID-19 lockdown. The film was originally a public exhibition but then evolved into a visual media piece due to being within social isolation. The experimental film is themed around the idea of injecting queer identity within a mainstream space. That manifested itself inside my own personal struggles, being a queer artist isolating within his own home town. The films non linear storyline has two platforms. One being the conversation between myself and the trans model, Grace Oni Smith, while within lockdown. The other, the process in which I used modern social programs to connect, create and interact with an audience from a remote location.  In association with Manchester School of Art and HOME.
response.title: Isolated Canvas
